javadoc: Basic implementation for a pointer dataType

methods.javadoc:
Creates a dynamically-sized default pointer data type.
 A dynamic pointer size of 4-bytes will be in used, but will adapt to a data type manager's 
 data organization when resolved.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a dynamically-sized default pointer data type.
 A dynamic pointer size of 4-bytes will be in used, but will adapt to a data type manager's 
 data organization when resolved.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a dynamically-sized default pointer data type.
 The pointer size is established dynamically based upon the data organization 
 associated with the specified dtm but can adapt to another data type manager's 
 data organization when resolved.
@param dtm data-type manager whose data organization should be used
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a dynamically-sized default pointer data type.
 The pointer size is established dynamically based upon the data organization 
 associated with the specified dtm but can adapt to another data type manager's 
 data organization when resolved.

params.name: dtm
params.comment: data-type manager whose data organization should be used

methods.javadoc:
Construct a dynamically-sized pointer to a referencedDataType
 A dynamic pointer size of 4-bytes will be in used, but will adapt to a data type manager's 
 data organization when resolved.
@param referencedDataType data type this pointer points to
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a dynamically-sized pointer to a referencedDataType
 A dynamic pointer size of 4-bytes will be in used, but will adapt to a data type manager's 
 data organization when resolved.

params.name: referencedDataType
params.comment: data type this pointer points to

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a pointer of a specified length to a referencedDataType.
 Note: It is preferred to use default sized pointers when possible (i.e., length=-1, 
 see #PointerDataType(DataType)) instead of explicitly specifying 
 the pointer length value.

params.name: referencedDataType
params.comment: data type this pointer points to

params.name: length
params.comment: pointer length (values = 0 will result in dynamically-sized pointer)

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a dynamically-sized pointer to the given data type.
 The pointer size is established dynamically based upon the data organization 
 associated with the specified dtm but can adapt to another data type manager's 
 data organization when resolved.

params.name: dtm
params.comment: data-type manager whose data organization should be used

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Construct a pointer of a specified length to a referencedDataType.
 Note: It is preferred to use default sized pointers when possible (i.e., length=-1, 
 see #PointerDataType(DataType, DataTypeManager)) instead of explicitly specifying 
 the pointer length value.

params.name: length
params.comment: pointer length (-1 will result in dynamically-sized pointer)

params.name: dtm
params.comment: associated data type manager whose data organization will be used

methods.javadoc: Return a unique name for this pointer
methods.name: constructUniqueName
methods.comment: Return a unique name for this pointer

methods.name: getAddressValue
methods.comment: Generate an address value based upon bytes stored at the specified buf location

params.name: buf
params.comment: memory buffer and stored pointer location

return.comment: pointer value or null if unusable buf or data

methods.name: getPointer
methods.comment: Get a pointer data-type instance with a default size

params.name: dtm
params.comment:
program data-type manager (required)
 a generic data-type will be returned if possible.

methods.name: getPointer
methods.comment:
Get a pointer data-type instance of the requested size.
 NOTE: The returned data-type will not be associated with any 
 particular data-type-manager and may therefore not utilize 
 dynamically-sized-pointers when a valid pointerSize is specified.
 If an invalid pointerSize is specified, a dynamically-size pointer
 will be returned whose length is based upon the default-data-organization.

name: PointerDataType
comment: Basic implementation for a pointer dataType
